org.plexian.pendulum

Class Chunk

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.plexian.pendulum.Chunk

  • public class Chunk
extends java.lang.Object
    Chunk class to manage large ammount of tiles easily, without putting stress on a lookup-matrix.
    Since:
    0.0.2
    Author:
    Walt

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Chunk.ChunkState
      This is just an enum that manages chunk states.

    • Field Detail

      • vcId

        private int vcId
        This is the unique id for our OpenGL display list. OpenGL uses ids instead of instances to handle display lists, so this is pretty much our access-token.

      • type

        private int type
        This is the chunk type for this chunk. There are 2 types so far: 0 (AIR), and 1 (MIXED).

      • position

        private Vector2d position
        This is simply an accessible way to store the original chunk position. Everything is set using offsets from this point.

      • endPosition

        private Vector2d endPosition
        This is simply an accessible way to store the max-offset that the chunk has. It is exactly at the end of the chunk, on both X and Y axis.

      • tiles

        private int[][] tiles
        This is an array holding the ids of each tile. Some people store the actual tiles in an array, but memory wise this is much simpler and more efficient.

      • tileAnimationStages

        private int[][] tileAnimationStages

      • random

        public static java.util.Random random
        This is simply an easy way to generate the chunk's blocks.

      • shaderProgram

        private ShaderProgram shaderProgram
        This is the shader program for the chunk. Passed by the world.

      • state

        private Chunk.ChunkState state
        The ChunkState this chunk is in.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Chunk

        public Chunk(double x,
             double y,
             int type)
        Create a new chunk at the chunk-coordinates (x, y), with type type. -Removed for now- @param shaderProgram The Shader Program to use for this chunk, generally passed by the World class.
        Parameters:
        x - The X-coordinate to create a chunk at.
        y - The Y-coordinate to create a chunk at.
        type - The chunk type. (@see type).

    • Method Detail

      • rebuild

        public void rebuild()
        This method rebuilds the chunk's display list as well as generates it.

      • build

        public void build()
        Build the chunk's tiles array.

      • render

        public void render()
        This method simply calls the display list, thereby rendering the chunk.

      • update

        public void update(boolean tick)
        This method updates any part of the chunk needed.

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Destroys the chunk.

      • getTile

        public int getTile(int x,
                   int y)
        Fetch the id of the tile at (x, y).
        Parameters:
        x - The X-coordinate to get the tile at.
        y - The Y-coordinate to get the tile at.
        Returns:
        The tile at (x, y) or 0 if not inside this chunk.

      • setTile

        public void setTile(int x,
                    int y,
                    int type)
        Set a tile at (x, y) with type type.
        Parameters:
        x - The X-coordinate to place a tile at.
        y - The Y-coordinate to place a tile at.
        type - The id of the tile to place at (x, y).

      • getPosition

        public Vector2d getPosition()
        Get the position of this chunk, in world coordinates.
        Returns:
        The position of this chunk in world coordinates.

      • getState

        public Chunk.ChunkState getState()
        Get the current chunk state.
        Returns:
        The current chunk state.

      • setState

        public void setState(Chunk.ChunkState state)
        Set the chunk state, locking/unlocking the chunk for loading/saving.
        Parameters:
        state - The state to set.

      • getTiles

        public int[][] getTiles()

      • getTileAsAABB

        public AABB getTileAsAABB(int x,
                          int y)
